title: Hart Memorial Trophy
summary: The Hart Memorial Trophy, originally known as the Hart Trophy is an annual award for the most valuable player of the National Hockey League (NHL), voted by the members of the Professional Hockey Writers' Association. The original trophy was donated to the league in 1923 by David Hart, the father of Cecil Hart, the longtime head coach of the Montreal Canadiens.
